name: The Roosevelt A Coast Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: although surrounded by many of the other larger 'chain' business hotels, this one retained a lot of charm. the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the rooms and services were on par with any other 4* quality business hotel. although i was there for fun, i would pick this hotel in a heartbeat if ever returning for business.
reviews.title: great location, great service, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's very well located, central to the CBD, access to monorail for touristy things, and right off highway for the day trip we took.
reviews.title: Spectacular location and good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally the Roosevelt and the Wickham are the best priced nice hotels in downtown Seattle. What can I say, it was nice and cheap enough with a great location but I was disappointed that there wasn't a room safe and the room bathroom was quite small. Its a bummer they didn't have a pool either, because the Wickham does.
reviews.title: Excellent location & charming hotel

reviews.text: We spent 2 separate nights, with a night in Victoria in between. The first night we had the jacuzzi suite on the 6th floor. Lovely large room and nice jet tub for 2. This room had partial view down Pine St. to ocean. The second night we opted for the basic queen. A very small, but clean and perfectly adequate accomodation. This one was on 12th floor, so really nice & quiet that far up from the street. Excellent location with a quick 7 blocks to Pike's Public Market and only a few blocks to Monorail going to Space Needle. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. As an added review I would suggest Elliott's for dinner, right on the water, wooonderful food!! Skip The Fisherman's restaurant down the street from it (mediocre at best & in similar price range) and as far as transportation to/from airport, the Gray Line Airporter Shuttle is fine coming from airport, but DO NOT get the round trip ticket(s), as the bus never showed up for us after waiting over an hour and finally rushing to take a cab.
reviews.title: Good Value and Close To Convention Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was exhibiting and attending a conference in the compensation and HR industry for my company (---------------) at the Seattle Convention Center. I was looking for a nearby hotel with a resonable price just for myself (not traveling with family). This hotel more than met my needs. It was within one block, the room was big enough, the front desk staff were friendly, and the price was right. It was also near the bus lines, stores, and only 7 or 8 blocks from Pike Place Market.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Roosevelt for two nights. I was concerned based on other reviews, but our experience of the Roosevelt was very good. Our room was clean and quiet. The services that we used were excellent, and I found all staff that we encountered to be friendly and helpful. The location is wonderful for first time visitors to Seattle, especially if you are looking for a close location to the Conference Center. We truly enjoyed our stay and have no negatives to pass on. Return visits to Seattle we will likely stay here again. We'd recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: No complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, so I would have rated this a 2, but I wanted the 1 to adjust the over-all score a little more.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money!! Please!

likes.liked: — Leaving...Seriously...I was so happy to get out.
likes.disliked: — Wasting almost $300 on a one night stay.

reviews.title: Pros and Cons
reviews.text: This place needs a serious facelift!! We had a Suite as I booked a romance package...What a horrible room!!! I have seen better Super 8 Motel rooms.
Dont stay here! There are much MUCH better places in Seattle...Like an alley or a shelter. I will never waste a penny at this hole again.
reviews.title: go elsewhere

reviews.text: It is really sad, as the staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel has great history...but it's a hole.
reviews.title: What a terrible place!

reviews.text: I stayed there for 2 nights early April and the overall impression is really good,
reviews.title: Best value

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and clean and the average rate was $140/night. The internet is to bought thru credit card. staff are so helpful and knowledgeable.
reviews.title: Cosy, reasonable and comfortable.

reviews.text: The location is superb, and is a walking distance from many nearby interests.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.text: highly recommended.
reviews.title: great location for conference

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. As usual I was travelling for business and working at a large event at the Washington State and Convention Center which is half a block away. It's a gem of a hotel so close to the centre and different to the other multinational hotels in the immediate area that are the same the world over.
reviews.title: charming, friendly, clean, great location

reviews.text: This was my second stay at this hotel and I do like the old ambiance of the place, with the plush carpets, places for you to sit and the ease of entry. The staff are very friendly and I appreciated Jennifer's humor at the front desk. The elevator though was another story. I had to wait at least ten minutes for the thing. And the staff finally had one of their own operating the elevator. When I returned some hours later, the elevator again would ignore the button at the first floor and would not open unless someone from another floor happened to come to the first floor. Quite annoying. There was one guest who was being particularly obnoxious to the staff and the staff were calm in the midst of adversity which I appreciated. The room: I think offering four dollars for use of the bottled water was a bit much and the hotel should re-think its policy on that. The television was appreciated. The coffeemaker ran well and did its thing. The divider doors in 1203 do stick and not close correctly, but I didn't need that. Overall good experience. I would go again, as soon as they fix that elevator!
reviews.title: Great Staff, Great Location, Lousy Elevator!
Excellent Location
reviews.text: This is a 1930's era hotel, so the rooms can be very small, but LOCATION,LOCATION,LOCATION!
on the corner of 7th Ave and Pine Street, Pacific Place is directly across the street. Nordstroms #1, the flagship store is out the Pine Street door and two blocks to the left.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: A lot of Seattle is walkable from this hotel, or just a short cab ride. It's also close to the bus and light rail tunnel (under the Nordstrom store) and the rail now goes to SEA-TAC airport.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: Pike Place Market is about 5 minutes west, and the water front maybe another 5 minutes beyond the market.
reviews.title: Pro's and Cons of staying at the Roosevelt

description: Historical hotel and iconic landmark located in the heart of downtown with easy access to Washington State Convention Center, Seattle's retail core, the famous Pike Place market, and the myriad of restaurant, entertainment and nightlife venues that Seattle has to offer. Downtown & Pine...can't get any closer.
